Instruction: Cook the mixture until the candy thermometer reads 240 degrees F (115 degrees C) while stirring continuously, then remove the pan from the heat.

Heat the mixture to reach 232 degrees Fahrenheit (112 degrees Celsius) or until a small amount of syrup dropped into cold water forms a soft ball that flattens when removed from the water and placed on a flat surface.

Stir in vanilla after removing from heat. Add butter and pecans, continuing to mix until thick and creamy; the mixture may lose some shine. Spoon onto waxed paper to cool at room temperature until set. Store in an airtight container at room temperature.
